Life in Lockdown: "Roses are white, even the virtual ones"

28/04/2020

Nouse talks to York Sport Union President, Maddi Cannell, about Virtual Roses 2020

Image by Luke Snell and Lancaster SU (Edited by Malu Aversa and Jonathan Wellington)

By Jonathan Wellington

'Life in Lockdown' is an interview series focusing on people, organisations or student societies who are adapting to isolation in interesting and innovative ways. If youâ€™d like to talk about your experiences in lockdown or share how your student group has adjusted during the pandemic, emailÂ editor@nouse.co.uk; weâ€™d love to hear from you.

This weekend sees York and Lancaster turn onto an unprecedented page in the Roses history book as Covid-19 and the resultant social distancing rules pushes Europeâ€™s largest Varsity event online. Nouse therefore spoke to York Sport Union President, Maddi Cannell, ahead of what is set to be an eventful weekend of virtual sport and a welcome distraction to get students back in touch with life at York.

â€œWeâ€™ve got 32 clubs and societies involved from York which is absolutely fantastic and thereâ€™s been even more clubs involved on the fundraising side of things. Importantly, Maddi stressed that â€œjust because it doesnâ€™t officially count, I do not want to be embarrassed by losing. Iâ€™m absolutely not losing this. We need bragging rights for next year. Roses are white, even the virtual ones.â€ A winnerâ€™s mentality.
